content.title: Bachelor in Computer Science and Industrial Automation
content.subtitle: Telemark University College

content.title: API Viewer
content.description:
The API Viewer makes it easy to view and navigate the Mattilbud API. It is implemented as an Elm app that is integrated into Mattilbud's admin website.

The API Viewer supports navigating the links that are available in the API. When navigating or changing the settings, the URL in the browser's address bar will update accordingly, which makes it easy to share the result with teammates.

The Mattilbud API supports different clients, requiring the clients to identify themselves with the API by sending a "client token" header. This makes it possible to target clients by platform, app version, OS version and so forth. To simulate a client, the API Viewer displays a dropdown list with the currently registered clients. The selected "client token" and "client OS version" are stored in local storage to avoid having to select the appropriate client again and again.

To make the API Viewer easily accessible, there are links from the various sections on the admin website to the corresponding location in the API.

content.title: Fix My City
content.description:
Fix My City is a mobile application that makes it easy for citizens to report problems in their local area. The application includes functionality such as retrieving your current location, taking a photograph, listing popular reports and also showing nearby reports on a map.

Winner of the category "Best design" at Stavanger Hackathon 2016.

The team consisted of Sigve Hølland, Christer Nordbø and Christian Rasmussen.

content.title: ETilbud
content.description:
ETilbud is a mobile application that displays weekly offers for all kind of stores, e.g. electronics, sports and food.

The team consists of Stian Bøe, Njaal Gjerde, Andreas Jørgensen and Christian Rasmussen.

Note: The application is no longer available in neither the App Store nor Google Play.

content.title: Assignment System
content.description:
Assignment System is a website where students can submit their programming assignments. The focus for the website was to improve the development experience for the students. The students should be able to solve and deliver programming assignments without even needing to set up the development environment on their own computers.

To achieve this goal the website includes functionality for running code and tests, and it has an editor that supports syntax highlighting, error checking and code completion.

This website was created as a part of the Master thesis by David Åse and Christian Rasmussen, conducted at NTNU in the Spring 2014. The Master thesis was based on a pre-project by David Åse, conducted at NTNU in the Fall 2013.

content.title: Mattilbud
content.description:
Mattilbud is a mobile application that shows an overview of weekly offers from most of the grocery stores in Norway.

The application is available for iOS and Android. As of January 13th, 2017 the application has been downloaded more than 775 000 times and it has about 200 000 weekly users.

The team consists of Stian Bøe, Njaal Gjerde, Andreas Jørgensen and Christian Rasmussen.

content.title: Barteguiden
content.description:
Barteguiden is a mobile application that shows an overview of cultural events in Trondheim, such as concerts, presentations, exhibitions and the like.

The application includes functionality such as showing basic information about the event, e.g. description, price, location, link to website, etc. Additionally it supports filtering by featured events, paid/free events, categories, adding events to favorites and adding events to your own calendar.

The application was developed by the voluntary organization Studentmediene i Trondheim AS.

Note: The application is no longer available in the App Store.

content.title: TineApp
content.description:
TineApp is a mobile application that helps farmers when naming their milk cows. It includes functionality such as top charts for most popular cow names, both for the whole country and in your local area, searching for cow names and displaying a plot of yearly popularity for a cow name.

The application won the 1st prize of Capra Code Challenge 2013.

The team consisted of Magnus Bae, Anders Bøe, Øyvind Høisæther, Sigbjørn Lund Olsen, Eirik Vigeland, David Åse and Christian Rasmussen.

content.title: BlogApp
content.description:
BlogApp is a website for blogging. It contains basic functionality for reading and writing blog posts, as well as functionality for commenting on these blog posts. My goal was to create a dynamic and user-friendly blog system.

The website was created as part of the subject "Databases and Web" at Telemark University College.

content.title: FriendlyLoan
content.description:
FriendlyLoan is a mobile application that helps you remember when, where and why you borrowed or lent money. Easily add new loans, settle debt with any friends and view the full history of loans.

Supports English and Norwegian localization.

Note: The application is no longer available in the App Store.

content.title: Global BMS Builder
content.description:
Global BMS Builder is an iPad application for programming control systems. The application was supposed to control Schneider-Electric's StruxureWare platform.

The application was created as a part of the my Bachelor thesis, conducted at Telemark University College in Spring 2011.

content.title: SudokuApp
content.description:
SodukoApp is a Windows application for playing the game Sudoku. It has functionality such as generating different board sizes, solving the current puzzle, importing and exporting puzzles, error indication and notes.

The application was part of the subject "Object-oriented programming" at Telemark University College. Students participating in this project were Erik Barsøe, Henrik Hopen and Christian Rasmussen.

content.title: TAC Vista for iPhone
content.description:
TAC Vista for iPhone is a mobile application that integrates with Schneider-Electric's software named TAC Vista. TAC Vista is a platform that controls and monitors PLCs.

The mobile application has functionality for listing the object structure, as well as reading and writing values from/to TAC Vista. This was achieved by creating a proxy server (VB.net) that runs on the same machine that runs TAC Vista. The mobile application communicates with the proxy server (which is discovered via Bonjour).

content.title: F1-project
content.description:
F1-project is a website that showcases a report named "Analysis and modeling of meteorological data".

This website was part of the subject "F1-project" at Telemark University College. Students participating in the project were Erik Barsøe, André Skare Berg, Christer Sørvik, Andreas Vaa, Matias Wilhelmsen and Christian Rasmussen.

content.title: IFK Norway
content.description: A website that formerly represented the karate organization named IFK Norway. It remained IFK Norway's website until the end of 2011.
